articles.title: About us
articles.contents:
Contents
About this Blog!
Academic publications
Theses
Third-party funded projects

About this Blog!
Welcome to our Blog! Here, you’ll find insights from our work as Data Analysts in the domain of scholarly communication. With this blog, we want to engage with the broader community about how to support data-driven workflows and decision-making around scholarly communication with R.
We are based at the Göttingen State and University Library, one of the largest academic libraries in Germany. We are using R-based tools in our everyday work and contribute to R package developments and training activities. In this blog, you’ll find news and case-studies around:
Open Access and Open Science Analytics
R Packages making use of open databases and helping us in our work
R Tools for interactive visualizations and dashboard developments
R-related training and outreach activities
We want to thank Maëlle Salmon for encouraging us to start a blog about our work. As a technical framework for the blog, we are using Distill for R Markdown, a new web publishing format optimized for scientific and technical writing.
Dr. Anne Hobert, Nick Haupka, Najko Jahn
Academic publications
We also publish in academic journals about our work.
Jahn, N., Matthias, L., & Laakso, M. (2022). Toward transparency of
hybrid open access through publisher‐provided metadata: An article‐level
study of Elsevier. Journal of the Association for Information Science
and Technology, 73(1), 104–118. https://doi.org/10.1002/asi.24549
Jahn, N., Held, M., Walter, H., Haupka, N., & Hillenkötter, K. (2022).
HOAD: Data Analytics für mehr Transparenz bei
Open-Access-Transformationsverträgen. ABI Technik, 42(1), 64–69.
https://doi.org/10.1515/abitech-2022-0007
Fraser, N., Hobert, A., Jahn, N., Mayr, P., & Peters, I. (2021). No
Deal: Investigating the Influence of Restricted Access to Elsevier
Journals on German Researchers’ Publishing and Citing Behaviours.
ArXiv:2105.12078. http://arxiv.org/abs/2105.12078
Hobert, A., Jahn, N., Mayr, P., Schmidt, B., & Taubert, N. (2021). Open
access uptake in Germany 2010–2018: adoption in a diverse research
landscape. Scientometrics, 126(12), 9751–9777.
https://doi.org/10.1007/s11192-021-04002-0
Laakso, M., Matthias, L., & Jahn, N. (2021). Open is not forever: A
study of vanished open access journals. Journal of the Association for
Information Science and Technology, 72(9), 1099–1112.
https://doi.org/10.1002/asi.24460 (Featured in Nature, Science and CNN)
Jahn, N., Hobert, A., & Haupka, N. (2021). Entwicklung und Typologie des
Datendiensts Unpaywall. Bibliothek Forschung und Praxis, 45(2),
293–303. https://doi.org/10.1515/bfp-2020-0115
Matthias, L., Jahn, N., & Laakso, M. (2019). The Two-Way Street of Open
Access Journal Publishing: Flip It and Reverse It. Publications, 7(2),
23. https://doi.org/10.3390/publications7020023
Theses
Haupka, N. (2021). Analyse der Entwicklung des Open Access-Discovery-Services Unpaywall seit 2018 [Bachelor Thesis, Hochschule Hannover]. https://doi.org/10.25968/opus-1899
Third-party funded projects
BMBF
OAUNI - Entwicklung und Einflussfaktoren des Open-Access-Publizierens an Universitäten in Deutschland
DFG
Hybrid OA Dashboards: Mehrwertorientierte Analytics-Anwendungen zur Förderung der Kostentransparenz bei Transformationsverträgen
European Commission
On-Merrit
OpenAIRE Nexus

articles.title: Open Scholarly Data @ SUB Göttingen - Overview
articles.contents:
Contents
Status Crossref
Status Unpaywall
Status Openalex

We use Google Big Query to work with large open scholarly data. Our main data sources are Unpaywall, Crossref and OpenAlex.
An overview of our data warehouse including procedures to load the data into BigQuery can be found below.
